# Load Packages

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
```

# Extract lnLikelihood values from the FC_Linked summary file across all 50,000 iterations
# Save them as a single tab-delimited text file for further analysis

```{r}
# Define input summary file and output table path
in_summary  <- "/Users/huncho/Desktop/Forensic_Kinship/94_SNP_Simulation/FC_Simulation/FC_Linked/likelihoods_FC_Linked_summary.txt"
out_table   <- "/Users/huncho/Desktop/Forensic_Kinship/94_SNP_Simulation/FC_Simulation/FC_Linked/FC_Linked_lnlikelihoods.txt"

# Read all lines from the input summary file
lines <- read_lines(in_summary)

# Keep only lines containing the phrase "lnLikelihood for 1 families"
keep   <- grep("(?i)lnLikelihood for 1 families", lines, perl = TRUE)
lines2  <- lines[keep]

# Extract the numeric value after "=" from each line
# e.g., from "... = -184.339" we extract "-184.339"
# Split each line at "=" and trim the numeric part
lnL <- sapply(strsplit(lines2, "="), function(x) trimws(x[2]))

# Build a tibble data frame with replicate numbers and corresponding lnLikelihood values
FC <- tibble(
  replicate    = sprintf("%05d", seq_along(lnL)),
  lnlikelihood = as.numeric(lnL)
)

# Write the table to file as a tab-delimited .txt
write_delim(FC, out_table, delim = "\t", col_names = TRUE)

```

# Compute likelihood ratios (LRs) and log10LRs using lnLikelihood values
# from both linked and unlinked kinship models across all replicates

```{r}
# Define file paths for all four lnLikelihood datasets:
# - FC_Linked vs FC_Linked_Unrelated (with linkage)
# - FC_Unlinked vs FC_Unlinked_Unrelated (no linkage)
FC_linked_fn         <- "/Users/huncho/Desktop/Forensic_Kinship/94_SNP_Simulation/FC_Simulation/FC_Linked/FC_Linked_lnlikelihoods.txt"
FC_linked_unrel_fn   <- "/Users/huncho/Desktop/Forensic_Kinship/94_SNP_Simulation/FC_Simulation/FC_Linked_Unrelated/FC_Linked_Unrelated_lnlikelihoods.txt"
FC_unlinked_fn       <- "/Users/huncho/Desktop/Forensic_Kinship/94_SNP_Simulation/FC_Simulation/FC_Unlinked/FC_Unlinked_lnlikelihoods.txt"
FC_unlinked_unrel_fn <- "/Users/huncho/Desktop/Forensic_Kinship/94_SNP_Simulation/FC_Simulation/FC_Unlinked_Unrelated/FC_Unlinked_Unrelated_lnlikelihoods.txt"

# Read each lnLikelihood file into a tibble
# Skip the header line and assign consistent column names and types
FC_linked <- read_tsv(
  FC_linked_fn,
  skip      = 1,
  col_names = c("replicate","lnL_FC_Linked"),
  col_types = cols(
    replicate       = col_character(),
    lnL_FC_Linked   = col_double()
  )
)

FC_linked_unrel <- read_tsv(
  FC_linked_unrel_fn,
  skip      = 1,
  col_names = c("replicate","lnL_FC_Linked_Unrelated"),
  col_types = cols(
    replicate                 = col_character(),
    lnL_FC_Linked_Unrelated   = col_double()
  )
)

FC_unlinked <- read_tsv(
  FC_unlinked_fn,
  skip      = 1,
  col_names = c("replicate","lnL_FC_Unlinked"),
  col_types = cols(
    replicate       = col_character(),
    lnL_FC_Unlinked = col_double()
  )
)

FC_unlinked_unrel <- read_tsv(
  FC_unlinked_unrel_fn,
  skip      = 1,
  col_names = c("replicate","lnL_FC_Unlinked_Unrelated"),
  col_types = cols(
    replicate                   = col_character(),
    lnL_FC_Unlinked_Unrelated   = col_double()
  )
)

# Join all four datasets by the replicate ID
# Creates a single tibble with lnLikelihoods for each comparison
LR_FC <- FC_linked %>%
  left_join(FC_linked_unrel,   by="replicate") %>%
  left_join(FC_unlinked,       by="replicate") %>%
  left_join(FC_unlinked_unrel, by="replicate")

# Calculate natural-log likelihood ratios (lnLRs) for both linked and unlinked models:
# lnLR = lnL(H1) - lnL(H0)
#
# Then convert lnLRs to:
# - plain likelihood ratios (LR = exp(lnLR))
# - base-10 log likelihood ratios (log10LR = lnLR / log(10))
LR_FC <- LR_FC %>%
  mutate(
    # natural‐log LRs
    logLR_linked   = lnL_FC_Linked   - lnL_FC_Linked_Unrelated,
    logLR_unlinked = lnL_FC_Unlinked  - lnL_FC_Unlinked_Unrelated,

    # plain LRs
    LR_linked      = exp(logLR_linked),
    LR_unlinked    = exp(logLR_unlinked),

    # optional base‐10 logs
    log10LR_linked   = logLR_linked   / log(10),
    log10LR_unlinked = logLR_unlinked / log(10)
  )

# Generate summary statistics (median, min, max) for log10LR values
# For both linked and unlinked models
summary_FC <- tibble(
  scenario     = c("linked","unlinked"),
  median_logLR = c(
    median(LR_FC$log10LR_linked,   na.rm=TRUE),
    median(LR_FC$log10LR_unlinked, na.rm=TRUE)
  ),
  min_logLR    = c(
    min(LR_FC$log10LR_linked,   na.rm=TRUE),
    min(LR_FC$log10LR_unlinked, na.rm=TRUE)
  ),
  max_logLR    = c(
    max(LR_FC$log10LR_linked,   na.rm=TRUE),
    max(LR_FC$log10LR_unlinked, na.rm=TRUE)
  )
)

# Save the full LR results and summary statistics to .txt files
write_tsv(LR_FC,       "FC_all_LR_results.txt")
write_tsv(summary_FC,   "FC_LR_summary_stats.txt")

```
